notes: ÖV 4 'Jakob' (1927-1929). Volvo's first production car, nicknamed after factory worker Jakob who test-drove prototypes. Side-valve inline-4 engine, rear-wheel drive. Open tourer body style. Only 275 units produced. Brass-era vehicle requiring specialized vintage restoration expertise and extremely rare parts. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo ÖV 4 article, January 2025 revision.

PV4 (1927-1929). Closed sedan variant of ÖV 4, also known as 'Göteborgsvagnen'. Side-valve inline-4 engine, rear-wheel drive. Weatherproof closed body for Swedish climate. Only 500 units produced. Brass-era vehicle requiring specialized vintage restoration expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volvo PV4 article, January 2025 revision.
